Class BaseController

java.lang.Object
controller.BaseController
Direct Known Subclasses:
AuthController, CareerCenterStaffController, CompanyRepController, CompanyRepRegistrationController, DataSaveController, StudentController
public abstract class BaseController extends Object
Abstract base class providing shared functionality for all controllers.

BaseController follows the Repository pattern by maintaining references to all data repositories and providing common validation utilities. All controllers in the system extend this class to access repositories and shared helper methods.

Design Pattern

This class implements aspects of several design patterns:

  • Repository Pattern: Provides centralized repository access
  • Template Method: Subclasses extend for specific user type operations
  • Dependency Injection: Repositories injected via constructor

Controller Hierarchy

 BaseController (abstract)
  ├── AuthController - Authentication and session management
  ├── StudentController - Student operations (apply, view, accept)
  ├── CompanyRepController - Company posting and application review
  ├── CareerCenterStaffController - Approval and oversight operations
  ├── CompanyRepRegistrationController - Registration workflow
  └── DataSaveController - Data persistence to CSV

Shared Responsibilities

  • Repository access management
  • Common validation utilities (email, null checks, range validation)
  • Consistent error handling patterns
  • Centralized dependency management

Repository Management

All repositories are protected final fields, ensuring:

  • Immutability after construction
  • Visibility to all subclasses
  • Thread-safety for repository references
  • Consistent access patterns
Since:
1.0

    • studentRepo

      protected final StudentRepository studentRepo
      Repository for student data access and persistence. Used by controllers handling student-related operations.

      Repository for company representative data access and persistence. Used by controllers handling company rep operations and authentication.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseController

      public BaseController(StudentRepository studentRepo, CompanyRepRepository repRepo, CareerCenterStaffRepository staffRepo, InternshipRepository internshipRepo, ApplicationRepository applicationRepo, WithdrawalRequestRepository withdrawalRepo)
      Constructs a BaseController with the specified repositories.

      Subclasses should call this constructor with the repositories they need, passing null for repositories not used by that particular controller.

      Example usage:

       // StudentController only needs 4 repositories
 super(students, null, null, internships, applications, withdrawals);
 
 // CompanyRepController needs 3 repositories
 super(null, reps, null, internships, applications, null);
      Parameters:
      studentRepo - student repository (can be null if not needed)
      repRepo - company representative repository (can be null if not needed)
      staffRepo - career center staff repository (can be null if not needed)
      internshipRepo - internship repository (can be null if not needed)
      applicationRepo - application repository (can be null if not needed)
      withdrawalRepo - withdrawal request repository (can be null if not needed)

  • Method Details

    • isEmailValid

      protected boolean isEmailValid(String email)
      Validates if an email address has proper format.

      Uses regex pattern matching to ensure email contains:

      • Local part (before @)
      • @ symbol
      • Domain name
      • Top-level domain (e.g., .com, .edu)

      Valid examples:

      • user@example.com
      • john.doe@company.co.uk
      • student123@university.edu

      Invalid examples:

      • user@domain (no TLD)
      • @example.com (no local part)
      • user example@test.com (contains space)
      Parameters:
      email - the email address to validate
      Returns:
      true if email format is valid, false otherwise

    • isNullOrEmpty

      protected boolean isNullOrEmpty(String str)
      Checks if a string is null or empty after trimming whitespace.

      This is a convenience method for validating required text fields. Returns true if the string is null or contains only whitespace.

      Examples:

       isNullOrEmpty(null)         → true
 isNullOrEmpty("")           → true
 isNullOrEmpty("   ")        → true
 isNullOrEmpty("text")       → false
 isNullOrEmpty("  text  ")   → false
      Parameters:
      str - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if string is null or empty after trimming, false otherwise

    • validateNotNegative

      protected void validateNotNegative(int value, String fieldName)
      Validates that an integer value is not negative.

      Used for validating counts, quantities, and other numeric fields that should not be negative (e.g., maxSlots, yearOfStudy).

      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to validate
      fieldName - descriptive name of the field for error messages
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is negative (less than 0)
